conclusion: The basketball is dropped from rest at a height H above the ground.
It undergoes an inelastic collision with the ground.
The magnitude of the air resistance experienced by the basketball is λ times the magnitude of the gravitational force acting on the basketball.
The magnitude of the gravitational force acting on the basketball is mg.
The magnitude of the air resistance experienced by the basketball is λmg.
The magnitude of the post-collision velocity is v.
The magnitude of the pre-collision velocity is v0.
The kinetic energy of the basketball before the collision is K0 = 1/2mv0^2.
The kinetic energy of the basketball after the collision is K = 1/2mv^2.
According to the principle of conservation of energy, K0 = K.
Solving for v, we get v = v0.
According to the principle of conservation of momentum, mv = mv0 + (m + λmg)v.
Solving for v, we get v = (mv0 + (m + λmg)v)/m.
The ratio of the post-collision velocity to the pre-collision velocity is v/v0 = 1 + λmg/m.
